original_title: Russia threatens Europe's cybersecurity - Prime Minister makes strategic decision
optimized_title: Poland Bolsters TVN, Polsat Cybersecurity Amid Russian Threats
description: Prime Minister Donald Tusk met with Estonian Prime Minister Kristen Michal in Warsaw. The talks focused on the security of Poland and Estonia, assistance to Ukraine, and cooperation in the region and within NATO. The politicians paid special attention to the need to ensure cybersecurity in Europe. That is why Donald Tusk decided that TVN and Polsat television stations will be placed on the list of strategic companies that are subject to special protection, e.g. against aggressive takeovers.

original_title: Orlen and banks dragged WIG20 down. The atmosphere around the Polish champion is getting thicker, and the share price is getting lower
optimized_title: Orlen and Banks Tumble, WIG20 Sinks as Polish Champ's Share Price Drops
description: The WIG20's shortness of breath has become a fact, which is why the index ended Wednesday's session with a clear sell-off, which is primarily due to the declines in the largest banks and Orlen. Shareholders are slowly losing patience with emerging doubts about the company's largest investment projects. Gaming stocks were under pressure again. In turn, the Rafako rally seems to have definitely come to an end in the face of new information.
summary: The WIG20 index fell significantly on Wednesday due to declines in major banks and Orlen, with investors growing impatient over doubts surrounding large investment projects. Meanwhile, gaming stocks remained under pressure, and the Rafako rally seemed to end with new information.

original_title: Tusk: TVN and Polsat will be on the list of strategic companies. Without the government's consent, it will not be possible to take over these companies
optimized_title: TVN, Polsat on Strategic List: No Takeovers Without Gov't Approval
description: TVN and Polsat television stations will be placed on the list of strategic companies that are subject to protection, e.g. against aggressive and dangerous (from the point of view of state interests) takeovers, Prime Minister Donald Tusk announced on Wednesday.
summary: Prime Minister Donald Tusk has announced that TVN and Polsat television stations will be placed on Poland's list of strategic companies, subject to government protection against unwanted or hostile takeovers. This move aims to safeguard state interests in these media enterprises.

original_title: US inflation up. No negative surprises, though
optimized_title: US Inflation Up, Meets Forecasts with No Surprises
description: November CPI inflation in the US turned out to be in line with economists’ forecasts. The increase in the consumer price index took place while maintaining the current core inflation, which was anchored at an elevated level.
summary: November's Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation in the US met economists’ forecasts, showing no negative surprises. Despite the increase, the core inflation remained at a high level, indicating continued economic stability.

original_title: NBP bought the most gold among central banks this year
optimized_title: **Poland's NBP Tops Gold Purchases Among Central Banks This Year**
description: By the end of September, the National Bank of Poland had purchased 42 tons of gold to increase its currency reserves, the largest amount among central banks in the world this year, the think tank OMFIF reported, citing data from the World Gold Council.
summary: Poland's National Bank of Poland (NBP) has purchased the highest amount of gold among central banks this year, acquiring 42 tons by the end of September to bolster its currency reserves. This move is part of the bank's strategy to diversify its reserves and enhance its financial stability.

original_title: LOT is preparing for a big purchase. Up to 84 new jets in the game
optimized_title: LOT Polish Airlines to Buy Up to 84 New Jets for Regional Routes
description: LOT Polish Airlines should select a supplier of new aircraft for regional routes in the first quarter of 2025, according to Wednesday's statement by Deputy Minister of Infrastructure Maciej Lasek.
summary: LOT Polish Airlines is set to purchase up to 84 new jets for its regional routes, with the supplier selection expected in the first quarter of 2025, as announced by Deputy Minister of Infrastructure Maciej Lasek. This significant investment aims to enhance the airline's fleet and operational capabilities.

original_title: Will More Ballistic Missiles Fall on Ukraine? US Intelligence: Kremlin Wants to Intimidate the West and Ukraine
optimized_title: US Intel: Russia to Launch More Missiles at Ukraine to Intimidate West
description: American intelligence believes that Russia may again fire the Oreshnik ballistic missile towards Ukraine in the coming days, AP reported, citing a US administration official. Washington believes that such actions by the Kremlin are a way to intimidate Ukraine.
summary: US intelligence indicates that Russia is likely to launch more ballistic missiles at Ukraine in the near future to intimidate both Ukraine and the West. The use of the Oreshnik missile is seen as a strategic move by the Kremlin to exert pressure and influence.

original_title: Polish Gaming Horror Charts: Several Years of Growth Eradicated in Three Months
optimized_title: Polish Gaming Stocks Plummet: 11 Bit Studios Leads Sector Decline
description: The 11 bit studios sell-off has brought the stock to its lowest level since March 2018. This is not the only major gaming company on the WSE that has been hitting multi-year lows in recent weeks. We show you charts of horrors for companies from the industry listed on the WSE. Although 95% of WIG-Gry companies are in the red this year, the entire index is recording some of the highest sectoral rates of return.
summary: The gaming industry in Poland has seen a significant decline, with 11 Bit Studios' stock hitting its lowest point since 2018. Several major gaming companies listed on the Warsaw Stock Exchange (WSE) have also reached multi-year lows. Despite this, the broader index shows strong sectoral returns, indicating a mixed performance within the gaming sector.

original_title: Beer rationing? Guinness keeps the English waiting
optimized_title: Guinness Supply Dwindles: Liverpool Pubs Ration Beer for Holidays
description: An Irish pub in Liverpool uses an average of 12 50-litre barrels a week. It has now received just half of its order. Across England, there are shortages of the Irish drink. Some bars have been without it since last Friday. Distributors say they are saving up to make it through Christmas and New Year's Eve, especially since the warehouses were emptied during the rugby games.
summary: Guinness supply shortages are affecting pubs in Liverpool and across England, with some bars running out of the Irish drink since last Friday. Distributors are rationing supplies to ensure availability during the holiday season, particularly for events like Christmas and New Year's Eve. This scarcity is attributed to increased demand during recent rugby games.

original_title: Auto giant winds down part of business: $10 billion down the drain
optimized_title: GM Halts Robotaxi Project: $10B Loss, Autonomous Focus Shifts to Personal Vehicles
description: General Motors said it would stop funding and end development of a robotaxi at Cruise. The project had cost $10 billion, but GM said it would now focus on developing autonomous systems for use in personal vehicles.
summary: General Motors has decided to discontinue its robotaxi project at Cruise, resulting in a $10 billion loss. The company will now redirect its efforts towards developing autonomous systems for personal vehicles.

original_title: LPP Group posted PLN 579 million in net profit in Q3, compared to the consensus of PLN 634.6 million
optimized_title: LPP Group's Q3 Net Profit Misses Expectations at PLN 579M
description: The LPP Group had PLN 579 million of net profit of the parent company in the third quarter of the 2024/25 financial year, compared to PLN 576 million a year ago, the company reported in a report. Analysts surveyed by PAP Biznes expected PLN 634.6 million of profit.
summary: LPP Group reported a net profit of PLN 579 million in Q3, slightly higher than the previous year's PLN 576 million but below analysts' expectations of PLN 634.6 million.

original_title: Orlen stops Olefina III investment. It was supposed to be PLN 8 billion, but it is over PLN 50 billion
optimized_title: Orlen Halts Olefin III, Redirects PLN 8B to New Chemistry Project
description: The Orlen Management Board has decided to stop the Olefiny III project, the concern informed in a statement. From now on, the work will be carried out as part of the New Chemistry project, in a way that allows for the rationalization of the necessary expenditures.
summary: Orlen has halted its Olefin III project, initially estimated at PLN 8 billion, and redirected efforts to a new project called New Chemistry, aiming to rationalize expenses that exceeded PLN 50 billion.

original_title: EPP MEPs call on the EC to withdraw the ban on combustion engines from 2035
optimized_title: EPP MEPs Urge EC to Reverse 2035 Ban on Combustion Cars
description: The European People's Party Group in the European Parliament - which includes PO and PSL - called on the EC on Wednesday to withdraw the ban on the sale of cars with combustion engines from 2035. We demand a return to technological neutrality, MEP Jens Gieseke announced at a press conference in Brussels.
summary: The European People's Party Group in the European Parliament, including Poland's PO and PSL, has called on the European Commission to withdraw the 2035 ban on the sale of cars with combustion engines. They advocate for a return to technological neutrality, allowing for a variety of technologies in the automotive industry.

original_title: Deputy head of the European Commission: In exceptional situations, member states may suspend the right to asylum
optimized_title: EU Vice-President: Temporary Asylum Suspension Allowed in Extreme Circumstances
description: The European Commission's vice-president for security and democracy, Henna Virkkunen, announced on Wednesday that EU countries, defending the security of the Union's borders, can take special measures, such as suspending the right to asylum. These measures must be exceptional and introduced temporarily, she stressed.
summary: The European Commission's vice-president for security and democracy, Henna Virkkunen, stated on Wednesday that EU nations can temporarily suspend the right to asylum to protect the Union's border security. She emphasized that such measures must be exceptional and only implemented on a temporary basis.

original_title: Russia's 'shadow fleet' of oil transporters targeted, Poland announces new sanctions package
optimized_title: Poland Targets Russia's 'Shadow Fleet' with New Sanctions Package
description: Finance Minister Andrzej Domański said in Brussels that Poland will seek to impose further sanctions on Russia, including the 16th package aimed at illegal trade in Russian oil.
summary: Poland has announced a new sanctions package targeting Russia's 'shadow fleet' of oil transporters, aiming to disrupt illegal trade in Russian oil. Finance Minister Andrzej Domański stated this in Brussels, indicating Poland's continued efforts to pressure Russia economically.
